title: Elon Musk finally reveals the truth about alien encounters
text:
Elon Musk says he is always being asked about aliens (AFP/Getty Images)

If there was anyone on Earth who should have received interstellar visitors, it would be Elon Musk.

The CEO of SpaceX pioneered reusable rockets, runs an electric car company, has grand ambitions of starting a colony on Mars and isn’t afraid to dabble with the ganja.

But he has said that the question he gets asked a lot is whether or not he’s made contact with aliens. Sadly, he says it’s never happened.

Last week, in front of a crowd of SpaceX employees, some guests and a few members of the media in Boca Chica, Texas, Musk finally confirmed the truth that we’ve never contacted aliens.

‘As far as we know, we’re the only consciousness, or the only life that’s out there,’ Musk said.

‘There might be other life, but we’ve seen no signs of it.’

‘People often ask me,’ Musk said, according to Space.com, ‘What do you know about the aliens?’ and I’m like, “Man, I tell you, pretty sure I’d know if there were aliens. I’ve not seen any sign of aliens.”‘

Musk is confident we haven’t ever had any close encounters of the third kind (Columbia Pictures)

During a recent visit to Shanhai, the genius tech mogul said it was fundamentally important for humans to launch Mars exploration missions.

‘Not from the standpoint of Mars just being an escape hatch or because I think Earth is doomed, but because there is a certain irreducible probability that something may happen to Earth,’ he said.

‘Despite our best intentions and everything we try to do, there is a probability of external forces or some internal unforced error causing civilisation to be destroyed or sufficiently impaired such that it can no longer extend to another planet.’

He said the fact we’ve not managed to see any aliens could indicate our society is doomed to destruction. Some scientists have suggested the reason humanity has been unable to detect extraterrestrial civilisations is that intelligent beings inevitably kill themselves or die out in natural disasters before becoming sophisticated enough to journey through space and send messages through the cosmos.

Elon Musk’s company SpaceX is leading the charge to colonise Mars (SpaceX)

‘I think we should not take it for granted that consciousness will continue because we have not encountered any aliens,’ Elon said.

‘I think the thing about Mars is that it’s important for us to take the set of actions that are most likely to continue consciousness into the future.’
